title: Quinton Jacobs
text:
Quinton Norman Jacobs (born 21 January 1979 in <a href="Windhoek">Windhoek</a>) is a Namibian <a href="association%20football">football</a> <a href="midfielder">midfielder</a> who last played for <a href="Black%20Africa%20S.C.">Black Africa Windhoek</a>.
Career.
Jacobs began his football career with <a href="Black%20Africa%20F.C.">Black Africa</a> in his native Namibia, playing for them from 1997 to 1999. In late 1998, he spent a trial period with <a href="Manchester%20United%20F.C.">Manchester United</a>, playing in a friendly for the club's reserve team against a <a href="Major%20League%20Soccer">Major League Soccer</a> Under-21s side.
After leaving Black Africa in 1999, he had a brief spell with <a href="Partick%20Thistle%20F.C.">Partick Thistle</a> in the <a href="Scottish%20Football%20League%20Second%20Division">Scottish Division Two</a>, after turning down offers from Ajax and Werder Bremen. He once scored directly from a corner kick in a match against Ross County at Firhill stadium.
He left Partick in 2000 and spent a year with German side <a href="MSV%20Duisburg">Duisburg</a>, but did not make a single appearance before joining South African side <a href="Black%20Leopards">Black Leopards</a> in 2001. In 2003, he moved back to Namibia to play for <a href="F.C.%20Civics%20Windhoek">Civics Windhoek</a>. He spent a year there and another year with <a href="Ramblers%20F.C.">Ramblers</a> before returning to South Africa to play for <a href="Ajax%20Cape%20Town%20FC">Ajax Cape Town</a> in 2005. In 2006, Jacobs got another chance in European football, joining <a href="Norway">Norway</a>'s <a href="Bryne%20FK">Bryne</a>, but after just one goal in 15 appearances, he rejoined Ramblers.
In 2009, he placed for <a href="African%20Stars">African Stars F.C.</a> in Namibia and joined <a href="State%20of%20Palestine">Palestinian</a> club <a href="Jabal%20Al%20Mukaber">Jabal Al Mukaber</a> early in 2010.
United Sikkim.
He played for the <a href="United%20Sikkim%20F.C.">United Sikkim F.C.</a> in the <a href="2012%20I-League%202nd%20Division">2012 I-League 2nd Division</a>. On 15 March 2012 he scored a brace which helped his side win 3–2 against <a href="Kalighat%20Milan%20Sangha%20F.C.">Kalighat Milan Sangha F.C.</a> in <a href="Siliguri">Siliguri</a>.
He had scored 16 goals in 23 matches in the 2nd Division for the <a href="Gangtok">Gangtok</a>-based club helping his side win promotion to the <a href="2012-13%20I-League">2012-13 I-League</a>.
Salgaocar.
On 6 May 2012 Jacobs signed with former Indian <a href="I-League">I-League</a> champions <a href="Salgaocar%20S.C.">Salgaocar</a>.
Mohun Bagan.
In January 2013, the century-old <a href="Kolkata">Kolkata</a>-based club <a href="Mohun%20Bagan%20A.C.">Mohun Bagan A.C.</a> signed this Namibian midfielder as a replacement to the underperforming <a href="Stanley%20Okoroigwe">Stanley Okoroigwe</a>. On 28th Match, he scored his first I-League goal for the club against <a href="Pailan%20Arrows">Pailan Arrows</a> in a 2–0 win at Kalyani. He also won the Man of the Match for the effort.
International career.
He is a member of the <a href="Namibia%20national%20football%20team">Namibia national football team</a>.
